item.title: Cold wave continues, affecting normal life in northern region
item.description: Although the minimum temperatures remained mostly unchanged and maximum temperatures increased slightly, the mild cold wave blowing over the northern region continued affecting the normal life for the third consecutive day. The sky remained partly cloudy and misty till noon with cold winds blowing

item.title: Serbia supports talks with Hungary's Mol over sale of sanctioned NIS oil firm
item.description: Serbia supports talks over the sale of a majority stake in the country's sanctioned NIS oil company currently taking place between its Russian owners and Hungary's MOL, the Tanjug news agency reported on Thursday, citing Serbia's energy minister. "The Hungarian government supported those talks, an

item.title: Bangladesh Election: 740,000 registered for postal voting
item.description: Some 740,000 voters, including more than 534,000 expatriates from different countries across the world, have been registered to vote through postal ballots in the national election scheduled for February 12, 2026. The Election Commission (EC) opened the ‘Postal Vote Bd’ app for the Out

item.title: Tarique’s homecoming not a party victory but democratic achievement: Hasnat Abdullah
item.description: Tarique Rahman’s return to Bangladesh after nearly one and a half decades in exile should be seen not as a personal or party achievement, but as a significant milestone in the country’s continued democratic struggle, said Hasnat Abdullah, chief coordinator (Southern) of the National Cit

item.title: Tarique’s return will ensure peaceful coexistence: GM Quader
item.description: Jatiya Party Chairman GM Quader has welcomed the return of BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman, suggesting that his homecoming after over 17 years in exile will serve as a catalyst for political harmony. In a message issued on Thursday, he said: “[Tarique’s] return will help consolidate

item.title: BNP to launch cleaning drive at July 36 Expressway (300-feet) on Friday morning
item.description: Dhaka Metropolitan North unit of Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) will conduct a voluntary clean-up drive tomorrow morning to remove waste generated following the massive public gathering held to mark the ‘historic homecoming’ of BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman. BNP Media Cell Con

item.title: Syria to start currency swap on January 1, central bank governor says
item.description: Syria will start swapping old banknotes for new ones from January 1, 2026, Central Bank Governor Abdelkader Husrieh said on Thursday, under a plan to replace Assad-era notes to try to strengthen the currency's value. Syria’s new government, led by Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa, is seeking

item.title: Forest great Robertson, ‘Picasso of our game’, dies at 72
item.description: John Robertson, the Nottingham Forest winger described by his manager Brian Clough as “a Picasso of our game”, has died at the age of 72, the Premier League club said on Thursday. He was a key member of Clough’s all-conquering Forest team, assisting Trevor Francis’s winner

item.title: Tarique Rahman returns home amid rapturous reception
item.description: Ending his 17 years in exile, BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman returned to Bangladesh on Thursday, greeted by a rapturous reception from hundreds of thousands of jubilant supporters, marking his homecoming as a historic and triumphant event. The BNP leader’s arrival marked a significant mo

item.title: Israeli military says it killed a member of Iran’s Quds Force in Lebanon
item.description: The Israeli military said on Thursday that its forces killed a member of Iran's Quds Force in Lebanon who had been involved in planning attacks from Syria and Lebanon. The military identified the man as Hussein Mahmoud Marshad al-Jawhari, calling him a key operative in the force's unit 840. He wa

item.title: New Year 2026 and Bangladesh's journey towards peace, progress, and prosperity
item.description: As Bangladesh welcomes the dawn of 2026, the nation finds itself at a decisive moment in its journey toward sustainable development, political stability, and social inclusion. This year is more than a simple turning of the calendar; it represents a critical juncture to reflect upon past achievement

item.title: Epoch-making Bangali singers of yesteryears
item.description: Long before the arrival of Uttam Kumar (1926-80), actor-director-screenwriter Pramathesh Barua (1903-51) was the first male heartthrob of Bangla cinema. His movie version of Devdas (1935) was most authentic. Like the Cumilla-born and raised, Victoria College-educated singer-musician Sachin Dev Burm
